is starts to simmer it's going to take
just a couple minutes see that as soon

put about an inch of water in a saucepan

so very critical the measurements to
make sure you get the ingredients all

right then we're going to do our dry

black pepper finely ground black pepper
freshly ground you not use anything out

mix that up set that aside that's your

by the way our my wife's hands much

semisweet dark chocolate chips all right
once that's mixed you are ready to make

couple tablespoons fit in there and you
know they come out sort of the same size
don't crowd them alright I'm going to do
two pans worth it you're going to get
about 24 out of this recipe in fact I
think we got 22 but it depends we're
going to put these in a 350 degree oven
for 12 minutes approximately
the recipe says 10 these took actually
like closer to 14 I did two pans so it
took a couple minutes longer I would say
10 to 12 minutes is probably good if
you're baking one one trade of time
they're just going to be barely set
they're going to look a little bit wet
when they come out you're going to leave
them on the pan for five minutes so that
they just set up a little bit then
you're going to transfer them to a
cooling rack allow to cool and then
consume and you are going to be amazed
at the intense chocolate enos of this
cookie you're not going to so much taste
the pepper as it's going to enhance that
chocolate flavor they're not you know
spicy if you bit into one you would be
like oh I'm tasting pepper it's really
interesting the effect it has on the
chocolate Thank You Michelle for sharing

hope you give those a try all the
